snippet: The problem of qualified low-income students who rarely end up at elite colleges is easy to fix and can be done at very low cost, a compelling study shows.
abstract: Editorial laments fact that qualified low-income students rarely end up at elite colleges, trend that inhibits upward mobility; heralds study showing that low-cost distribution of application guides to such students significantly improves chances that they will apply to schools that match their abilities.
lead_paragraph: The problem of qualified low-income students who rarely end up at elite colleges is easy to fix and can be done at very low cost, a compelling study shows.

headline.seo: From Poverty to a Top-Tier College
headline.main: From Poverty to a Top-Tier College
headline.print_headline: From Poverty to a Top-Tier College
